cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 200 miles SSE of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coast, then moving inland across Arkansas and the Mid-Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX/LA border (around Cameron–Lake Charles area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane watches confined to east of Intracoastal City LA to west of Morgan City LA (NW Gulf Coast) – none for Florida
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge warnings from San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA – none for Florida
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-west Gulf Coast from Freeport TX to the mouth of the Mississippi River; inland through LA, AR, and later the Mid-South
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected; breezy conditions at most
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on Atlantic side of South Florida
weather_observation.rainfall: No heavy rainfall directly associated with Laura expected
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor increase in rip-current risk possible on Gulf beaches of South Florida; negligible impact to port operations
